intro: Malanea sanluisensis, commonly known as the San Luis mallow, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of San Luis, Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton, hibiscus, and okra. The plant is characterized by its large, showy pink or purple flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the semi-arid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
